data.title: California State University Stanislaus
data.meta_description: Stanislaus State: An exceptional public university that, because of its student-friendly size and commitment to excellence, is able to offer all the benefits of a private education.
data.text:
At A Glance

Our small class sizes, variety of programs and vibrant campus life mean that at Stan State you’ll find opportunities, connections and the best path forward for you.

17:1

Student-to-Faculty ratio

48

Undergraduate Programs

26

Graduate Programs

50+

Student Clubs & Organizations

In the West on 'Best Bang for the Buck' Ranking

Straight Year on The Princeton Review's 'Best 389' List

Stars/Named one of America's Best Colleges by Money.com

For Social Mobility in the West by U.S. News & World Report

What’s going on

at Stan State

There are lots of ways to connect with fellow Warriors! Check out our upcoming events and recent news about your Stan State community.

Warriors are strong. Warriors are proud. Warriors are committed to having a positive impact on the world. Check out what some of the students, faculty, staff and alumni are doing to make a difference in the region and beyond.

Warrior Spotlight

Go Warriors!

Stanislaus State is a member of the NCAA Division II and fields 14 men’s and women’s athletics teams in the California Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA) and the Pacific West Conference. Our teams consistently compete for conference and national championships while maintaining high academic standards for our student-athletes.

Connect with Stan State

Follow us on social and be a part of the conversation — and be in the know about all upcoming events and opportunities for Warriors, on campus and off.

Social Media Directory

McNair Scholars Director Nicole Cochran Aspires to Expand Program for Prospective Graduate School Students

Tag along with #StanState student Trent Lauderdale for a day and catch a glimpse of his life on campus!

Celebrate the growth of the #StanState Stockton Campus at University Park! This event signifies the exciting start of a transformative journey, symbolizing progress, innovation and the promise of a vibrant future for our campus community & Stockton.
